contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=February 2013}} This article is about the [[demographics|demographic]] features of the [[population]] of the [[Dominican Republic]], including [[population density]], [[Ethnic group|ethnicity]], education level, health of the populace, economic status, religious affiliations and other aspects of the population. <ref>http://www.one.gov.do/index.php?module=articles&func=view&catid=74</ref> {| class="wikitable" |- ! ! width="90pt"|Population ! width="90pt"|Births ! width="90pt"|Deaths ! width="90pt"|Natural change ! width="90pt"|Birth rate ! width="90pt"|Death rate ! width="90pt"|Natural change ! width="90pt"|Fertility Rate |- | 2007 | align="right" | | align="right" | 138 047 | align="right" | 33 009 | align="right" | 105 038 | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | |- | 2008 | align="right" | | align="right" | 141 702 | align="right" | 32 991 | align="right" | 108 711 | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | |- | 2009 | align="right" | | align="right" | 141 184 | align="right" | 32 826 | align="right" | 108 358 | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | |- | 2010 | align="right" | 9 445 281 | align="right" | 138 752 | align="right" | 35 244 | align="right" | 103 508 | align="right" | 14.69 | align="right" | 3.73 | align="right" | 10.96 | align="right" | |- | 2011 | align="right" | | align="right" | 128 836 | align="right" | 33 995 | align="right" | 94 841 | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | | align="right" | |- |} == Largest cities and metropolitan areas == {{Largest cities of the Dominican Republic}} == CIA World Factbook statistics == The following data are from the [[CIA World Factbook]] (update of January 15, 2010),<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/dr.html |title=CIA - The World Factbook -- Dominican Republic |accessdate=2010-02-12}}</ref> unless otherwise indicated. Population: 10,089 (July 2012 est.) ===Life expectancy=== ''Female:'' 79.69 years (2012 est.) <br />''Male:'' 75.28 years <br />''Average:'' 77.44 years ===Age structure=== ''0-14 years:'' 31.4% (male 1,543,141/female 1,488,016) <br />''15-64 years:'' 62.7% (male 3,087,351/female 2,960,319) <br />''65 years and older:'' 5.9% (Male 247,738; Female 285,407) (2009 est.) ===Population growth rate=== 1.489% (2009 est.) ===Birth rate=== 22.39 births/1,000 population (2009 est.) ===Death rate=== 7.30deaths/1,000 population (July 2009 est.) ===Net migration rate=== -2.22 migrant(s)/1,000 population (2009 est.) ===Urbanization=== ''Urban population:'' 69% of total population (2008) <br />''rate of urbanization:'' 2.6% annual rate of change (2005-10 est.) ===Sex ratio=== ''at birth:'' 1.04 male(s)/female <br />''under 15 years:'' 1.04 male(s)/female <br />''15-64 years:'' 1.04 male(s)/female <br />''65 years and older:'' 0.86 male(s)/female <br />''total population:'' 1.03 male(s)/female (2009 est.) ===Infant mortality rate=== ''total:'' 25.96 deaths/1,000 live births <br />''male:'' 28 deaths/1,000 live births <br />''female:'' 23.84 deaths/1,000 live births (2009 est.) ===Life expectancy at birth=== ''total population:'' 73.7 years <br />''male:'' 71.88 years <br />''female:'' 75.6 years (2009 est.) ===Total fertility rate=== 2.76 children born/woman (2009 est.) 2.44 children born/woman (2011 est.) ===Nationality=== ''noun:'' Dominican(s) <br />''adjective:'' Dominican ===Ethnic groups=== [[Multiracial|mixed]] 73%, white 16%, black 11% ===Religions=== Roman Catholic 95%, other 5% ===Languages=== [[Spanish language|Spanish]] ===Literacy=== ''definition:'' age 15 and older can read and write <br />''total population:'' 87% <br />''male:'' 86.8% <br />''female:'' 87.2% (2002 census) == References == {{Reflist}} {{North America in topic|Demographics of}} {{Dominican Republic topics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Demographics Of The Dominican Republic}} [[Category:Demographics by country|Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Dominican Republic society]]
